resources: The problem of scarcity in economics: "A student studying a one-year Masters degree in Actuarial Science has course fees of £12,000. Were she not studying she could have had a job paying an aftertax income of £20,000. Irrespective of whether she studies or works the cost of her accommodation is £7,000 and the food bill is £3,000. The opportunity cost of studying for the Masters degree is:" "If the cost of production increases and consumer income rises, the combined effect on the equilibrium price and quantity of an inferior good is:" "Wheat is an essential input in the production of pasta. An increase in the price of wheat would have an impact on the demand and supply of pasta by shifting the:" "Consumer A has a higher income than Consumer B but they have identical preferences and pay the same prices for the goods which they consume. If both consumers maximise utility then the marginal utility from each good consumed will be:" "A firm’s decision to reduce its expenditure on advertising is most likely to have the following impact on its demand curve:" Which of the following does NOT contribute to economies of scale? "Assume that a firm has a fixed capital stock and variable units of labour as the only inputs into its production process. If increasing amounts of the variable labour input are added to the fixed factor, then according to the law of diminishing returns which of the following is FALSE?" "Which one of the following conditions indicates that a firm is operating in a perfectly competitive industry rather than a monopolistic industry?" "A profit maximising monopoly facing a linear demand schedule and with positive marginal costs will set its price in the region of the demand curve where the absolute price elasticity of demand is:" In the kinked demand curve theory of oligopoly the: "Which of the following is NOT a supply side economic policy aimed at promoting economic growth?" “Supply creates its own demand” is also known as: "Which of the following will result in an improvement in the domestic country’s terms of trade?" Which of the following is an example of disequilibrium unemployment? "A country with a population of 38 million has 32 million in employment and 2 million unemployed. What is the unemployment rate?" "Which of the following is least likely to lead to an increase in long run economic growth?" Which of the following is a potential source of cost push inflation? Which of the following does NOT form part of a country’s Gross Domestic Product? "Other things being equal, an increase in the level of real output in an economy will result in:" "According to the quantity theory of money, a 10 per cent increase in the nominal money supply will lead to an increase in the real output level of the economy of:" “Crowding out” describes the: In the event of a recession in the economy, automatic fiscal stabilisers: "Which one of the following is likely to be the most effective method of reducing the natural rate of unemployment?" "Which of the following might explain why a country’s aggregate demand curve might shift inwards to the left?" Unanticipated inflation:
